chunks.en: Eating, how do you say it in your hometown?

chunks.zh: 看到春晚薛之谦唱赵英俊的歌曲《方的言》，里面有一句‘吃饭，你家乡怎么念’很有感触，突然好奇大家老家的‘吃饭’都是怎么说的，印象中只有东北的‘干饭’。
chunks.en: Seeing Xue Zhiqian singing Zhao Yingjun's song 'Dialects' on the Spring Festival Gala, the line 'Eating, how do you say it in your hometown?' was very touching. I suddenly became curious about how everyone's hometown says 'eating'. In my memory, only the Northeast says 'gan fan'.
qi fan

chunks.zh: 食饭‌在粤语中，表示“吃饭”的说法是“食饭”，其中“食”读作 sek ，饭读作 faan‌。具体来说，“食”的发音类似于英文“six”的发音，但不需要尾音；“饭”的发音类似于普通话中的“返”。‌12此外，粤语中还有一些与“吃饭”相关的日常用语，例如：“你食咗饭未？”（你吃了饭没有？）“食咗未？”（吃了没有？）“食咗饭啦！”（已经吃过饭了！）
chunks.en: In Cantonese, 'eating' is expressed as '食饭 (sik faan)'. '食 (sik)' is pronounced similar to 'six' in English, but without the trailing sound. '饭 (faan)' is pronounced similar to '返' in Mandarin. Furthermore, there are some daily expressions related to 'eating' in Cantonese, such as: '你食咗饭未？' (Have you eaten?), '食咗未？' (Eaten yet?), '食咗饭啦！' (I've already eaten!).
Jiabeng (euphemism for the emperor's death, literally 'ascended to heaven')
Qia fan (slang for making a living, literally 'earn food')

chunks.zh: @JamboSmile #38 河南 喝汤指的是 吃晚饭 午饭是 晌午饭 早饭是 青早饭
chunks.en: @JamboSmile #38 In Henan, 'he tang' (drinking soup) refers to eating dinner. Lunch is 'shang wu fan', and breakfast is 'qing zao fan'.
He tang (drinking soup)
kie fan ke yi ye fan
Wo qiu li
Gia shai
@DT27 #8 Yantai is clearly 'dai fan'
Wu dialect: die fan

chunks.zh: @cat 一看就是老乡，老爷保号，哈哈
chunks.en: @cat You can tell you're from the same hometown, 'laoye bao hao', haha.
Qi fan

chunks.zh: @mouseman 这个有听过，具体是哪里的不知道
chunks.en: @mouseman I've heard this, but I don't know where it's from specifically.
@cat Zhen du jia du (Really real or fake fake?)
@treobery111 Are you from Hubei?
Shandong Yantai, same as the commenter above, 'qi fan'.
xia ma
Qi fan
Die fan
